resources.string:
All red blood cells (erythrocytes) are surrounded by a sheath. On this envelope there are characteristic structures (antigens) that distinguish red blood cells of one person from those of another. In the AB0 blood group system, the antigens on the red blood cell sheath are divided into four groups: A, B, AB and 0. 
 Blood group A: There is only antigen A on the sheath of red blood cells. 
 Blood group B: Only antigen B is present. 
Blood group 0: No antigens are present. 
 Blood group AB: Both antigens A and B are present on the red blood cells.

"The blood groups can not only be distinguished by the red blood cells. Special proteins are found in the blood plasma: the blood group antibodies. These antibodies are able to recognize blood of a foreign blood group."

These options do not refer to the gender but to the sex with which you were born. (I.e. biological attributes such as external characteristics, chromosomes, hormones, etc.) These are used to determine the next time to donate blood.
You can donate whole Blood again!
Help us to keep the blood supply at the Uni.Blutspendedinest OWL always at a sufficient level to ensure the supply of our patients.
